alert.note: Alert for Eastern Preston; Eastern Tucker (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pittsburgh (Western Pennsylvania and East Central Ohio)
info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued December 13 at 11:05AM EST until December 15 at 10:00PM EST by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY EVENING THROUGH THURSDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Heavy wintry mix possible. Total snow accumulations up to one inch and ice accumulations from one quarter to a third of an inch. Winds could gust as high as 45 mph. * WHERE...In Pennsylvania, Higher Elevations of Fayette, Higher Elevations of Westmoreland, and Indiana Counties. In West Virginia, Eastern Preston and Eastern Tucker Counties. * WHEN...From Wednesday evening through Thursday evening. * IMPACTS...Roads, and especially bridges and overpasses, will likely become slick and hazardous. Significant ice accumulation on power lines and tree limbs may cause power outages. The hazardous conditions could impact the Thursday morning and evening commutes. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation. Persons should consider delaying all travel. Motorists should use extreme caution if travel is absolutely necessary.
